title: Wave properties - amplitude and energy vs loudness

content.description: A student is using a loudspeaker to generate sound waves. The loudspeaker can be used to generate different sound waves at the same frequency <math alttext="f sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The loudspeaker first produces an amount of energy <math alttext="E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> in a time interval <math alttext="delta t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> to generate Sound Wave <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, which has an amplitude <math alttext="A sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The loudspeaker then produces an amount of energy <math alttext="E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> in the same time interval <math alttext="delta t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> to generate Sound Wave <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, which has an amplitude <math alttext="A sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. If Sound Wave <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is louder than Sound Wave <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="A sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="A sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?
content.question: AmplitudeEnergyA<math alttext="A sub 1, end sub, is greater than, A sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math><math alttext="E sub 1, end sub, is greater than, E sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>B<math alttext="A sub 1, end sub, is greater than, A sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math><math alttext="E sub 2, end sub, is greater than, E sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>C<math alttext="A sub 2, end sub, is greater than, A sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math><math alttext="E sub 1, end sub, is greater than, E sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>D<math alttext="A sub 2, end sub, is greater than, A sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math><math alttext="E sub 2, end sub, is greater than, E sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

topic.text: 14.1: Properties of Wave Pulses and Waves

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
